column4: I am a windows user and am installing Ubuntu. I had to uninstall it and go back to windows because I couldn't enable the Broadcom WIFI driver. Can anyone explain how to do this in newbie terms? I dont know what the $#@! I am doing.
Do you know which exact chipset it is?
Like BCM4318 or something similar? I have two different Broadcom chipsets that I can help you with on it.
> no, it shows up as a Broadcom 43xx
Can you get the make and model of your wi-fi card?
Make and model laptop?
EG Dell Vostro 1700
Lemme Google it.
Found it. It's a BCM4306.
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=340689&highlight=bcm4306
Reinstall Linux, but this time hook up the ethernet port to a router or something instead of using wireless until it can install wireless.
How come you can't do that?
Ahh. Maybe you can get the packages and install offline. Lemme try that.
The link I gave you isn't hard at all.
It's only involved.
Download the latest ndiswrapper from here: http://sourceforge.net/project/showfiles.php?group_id=93482
Are you gonna run Ubuntu 32 or 64 bit?
Oh crud this is harder than I thought. :|
You'll just have to get a wired ethernet connection first. Sorry but the guides I'm using aren't showing ways to do it.
Maybe check this: http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=405990
Actually you can download it to your C:\ directory and access it through Ubuntu through the Places menu on the taskbar.
